I managed to make Quest running on Linux using Wine, but to achieve that one must have mswindows installed on another partition, otherwise it won't work I personally don't think QDK should be ported to Unix/Linux, and I think Alex would prefer to keep the "commercial part" of Quest on mswindows, unless the QDK version on Linux would be commercialised. On the other hand a parser for playing games would be very beneficial for the Quest "community". With such a parser, several ports of Quest could be made : one in console mode, one in graphical mode etc. (like ports of frotz for console, frotz for X window...) Maybe Alex could help about such a parser ? This way the huge interactive fiction community who swear only by *nix systems would consider Quest better. And also maybe some new libraries for Quest could be made by them... Tell us more about your project, and if you need a beta tester, you know I'm here !

Thanks very much for the response everyone. If you're wondering, I did get permission from alex before I posted this.

Primarily, I want to make the Quest engine (parser) for Linux and then implement it within a shell environment. If that all goes well, I might consider doing a version for X-Window/XFree86.

I did manage to get Quest running on via Wine on my main system but I got some errors, etc.

If the linux version is a success and there is enough demand, I'll probably do a Linux port of QDK.

As for beta testing, I'll release a beta version on the forums when I feel I'm ready to.
